member.name: T:Microsoft.Web.Http.ControllerNameAttribute
member.content: Provides additional implementation specific to ASP.NET Web API.
member.summary: Represents the metadata to describe the name of a controller.
member.remarks: This attribute is required to support service versioning on ASP.NET controllers that use convention-based routing because the route is inferred from the type name and service API versions may be implemented using different controller types.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Web.Http.Versioning.ApiVersioningOptions.ReportApiVersions
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether requests report the service API version compatibility information in responses.
member.value: True if the responses contain service API version compatibility information; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

remarks.para: When this property is set to true, the HTTP headers "api-supported-versions" and "api-deprecated-versions" will be added to all valid service routes. This information is useful for advertising which versions are supported and scheduled for deprecation to clients. This information is also useful when supporting the OPTIONS verb.

By setting this property to true, the will be added a global action filter. To enable more granular control over when service API versions are reported, apply the on specific controllers or controller actions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Web.Http.Versioning.ApiVersioningOptions.AssumeDefaultVersionWhenUnspecified
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a default version is assumed when a client does does not provide a service API version.
member.value: True if the a default API version should be assumed when a client does not provide a service API version; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: When a default API version is assumed, the version used is based up the result of the method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Web.Http.Versioning.ApiVersioningOptions.DefaultApiVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the default API version applied to services that do not have explicit versions.
member.value: The default API version. The default value is .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Web.Http.Versioning.ApiVersioningOptions.ApiVersionReader
member.summary: Gets or sets the service API version reader.
member.value: An API version reader object. The default value is an instance of the .
member.remarks: The API version reader is used to read the service API version specified by a client. The default value is the , which only reads the service API version from the "api-version" query string parameter. Replace the default value with an alternate implementation, such as the , which can read the service API version from additional information like HTTP headers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Web.Http.Versioning.ApiVersioningOptions.ApiVersionSelector
member.summary: Gets or sets the service API version selector.
member.value: An API version selector object. The default value is an instance of the .
member.remarks: The API version selector is used to select an appropriate API version when a client does not specify a version. The default value is the , which always selects the .

member.summary: Gets the API versions deprecated by the controller.

member.remarks: A deprecated API version does not mean it is not supported by the controller. A deprecated API version is typically advertised six months or more before it becomes unsupported; in which case, the controller would no longer indicate that it is an implemented version.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Web.Http.ApiVersion.ToString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the text representation of the version using the specified format and format provider.
member.param: The format to return the text representation in.
member.returns: The string representation of the version.
member.remarks:
The supported format codes are:
Format Description
G, g Returns only the group version, if present.
V, v Returns only the major and minor versions, if present.
S, s Returns full API version with the status, if status is present.
F, f Returns the full API version.
member.exception: The specified is null or any empty string.
The specified is not one of the supported format values.

member.summary: Gets the API versions deprecated by the controller.
member.returns: A read-only list of API versions deprecated by the controller.
member.remarks: A deprecated API version does not mean it is not supported by the controller. A deprecated API version is typically advertised six months or more before it becomes unsupported; in which case, the controller would no longer indicate that it is an implemented version.
